property.name: text
property.value: This CarWash model demonstrates using Ptera (Ptolemy Event Relationship Model) and model transformation to achieve dynamic updating of the model being executed.

property.name: text
property.value: This CarWash system consists of multiple parallel servers sharing a single queue, at which customers arrive. The number of servers is specified in InitServers. The number of customers in the queue at the beginning of the simulation is specified in InitQueue. When the model is run, a plot appears that shows the number of available servers and the number of customers in line over time.

property.name: text
property.value: The ModelUpdater keeps track of the the number of waiting cars during execution. Initially it sets the servers to slow mode, spending 10.0+20.0*random() virtual seconds on each car. If the number of waiting cars exceeds 20, it turns the servers into fast mode, taking only 5.0+ 20.0*random() virtual seconds to serve a car. The servers are switched back to slow mode if the number of waiting cars drops below 10.

property.name: text
property.value: This demo is an improved version of the Ptera CarWash demo, which does not have the ModelUpdate component and is not adaptive.

property.name: actions
actions
actions
